Author: raghus
Title: Valley Exec Twitters Through Home Break-In

Author: TomOfTTB
Content:
I've only heard Mr. Morris' name in passing but it sounds like he's in unbearable pain.

I'm on the fence about people's right to kill themselves. But when someone's in pain I try to accept the decision even if I disagree with it.

In that way I feel kind of weird about this.

I know I have developed friendships with people online. I care about these people as much as I care about people in the real world and if they were in this situation and wanted to say goodbye I'd want to hear it.

Launching a search party to stop him based on this goodbye discourages others from saying goodbye in the future.

I don't know. I guess if I read this message from a friend I'd probably instinctively do the same thing and rush to stop them. But as someone detached it just makes me feel uneasy.

Author: easp
Content: Even under the less restrictive licenses like BSD/Apache/MIT, there is a strong incentive to contribute private changes back to the project.  If you don't, then the public version and your private version start to diverge and it takes more and more work to take advantage of fixes and new features as the public version progresses.

Author: wooby
Content: Use Kismac to collect MAC addresses with significant packets in/out, clone a MAC, ssh -D9091 to my remote server, tunnel everything through my local SOCKS5 port 9091.  Works well enough for me.

Title: Learn the Power of Amnesia with Erlang

Author: jorgeortiz85
Content:
From the mailing list:

As an update to everyone who is assisting looking for Tony:- Tony's family are fully aware of the situation and have been contacted. Police are assisting with the matter, but as of yet Tony is un-contactable.

He has taken his motorbike; if anyone can suggest where he might be please email kristian.domagala@gmail.com or brad.clow@workingmouse.com and we will forward the information on.
